intro: Crepis triasii var. vidali, commonly known as the Vidali's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It is a perennial species that thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered plant in many parts of its range.
